botanical_details.potentially_harmful: Harmful if eaten/skin and eye irritant. Wear gloves and other protective equipment when handling
botanical_details.genus: Aglaonema are rhizomatous evergreen perennials with short stems bearing long-stalked, often attractively variegated leaves and rather insignificant, greenish or cream flowering spathes

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow as a house or conservatory plant in houseplant compost, position the plants in bright, filtered light. The leaves may burn in direct sun. Water moderately; allow some drying out in between applications in winter. Mist daily and apply a balanced liquid fertiliser monthly during the growing season. Pot on every 2-3 years. See houseplant cultivation for further information
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by separating basal shoots with 3 or 4 leaves, ideally with roots attached, or divide in spring
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to mealy bugs
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to root and stem rots if the growing medium is too wet
